main event: A round object, the size of a quarter at arm's length, was observed dropping, ascending, and then disappearing in Long Beach, California on July 7, 1952.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 1 minute., The object was reported to have ascended after dropping., The observer was considered to have a high degree of reliability., There were no weather balloons reported in the area at the time of the sighting., The case was classified as Probably Astronomical by ATIC evaluations.
witness description: the observer possibly had a high degree of reliability
